intro: Asplenium abscissum var. firmum, commonly known as the firm moss fern, is a variant of the common rock fern. It is a small, evergreen fern that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant has delicate, leathery fronds that are often clustered closely together. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its unique, tightly packed foliage. This variety is noted for its resilience and is often found in rocky or crevice habitats.
